website_summaries.verdict: Upgraded budget model with a diamond bit grinder. Fairly quiet model best suited to small and medium-size dogs.
pros: For skittish dogs, it's safer and easier to grind nails than snip them
Once dogs get accustomed to the sound, using the grinder cuts stress as well as nails
cons: Unit is quiet but some dogs still don't like it
Many users wanted more grinding power

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for "drama queens"
customer_reviews.text: I have a typical Shiba Inu - a born drama queen. She screams so badly even if the nail trimmer is inches away. There is no easy way to trim her. This grinder save us both. She's curious and licks it, never shows any fears or anxiety with it. It easily smoothes her sharp tips.
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, safe for pets.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. It has two gear of turning speed, I used the low speed at the begining. It’s better to use after the nails are trimmed. It will make the nails round and feel smoother. It can be used wirelessly and it comes with the usb charging cable and a spare grinding wheel. My dog is usually terrified by nail trimming or grinding, I have to take him to the grooming stores sometime. But this product is very quite compared to other similar brands. I let my dog to get familiar with the grinding sound before start using it, which took only a few minutes, and then he just relax and let me do the work.
customer_reviews.author: xxhelios

customer_reviews.title: Two settings, safe and easy to use for kittens
customer_reviews.text: Very easy and safe to use. Comes with two settings, one for small pets and the other for big pets, so I can use it for my kitten even when she grows up.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This nail grinder is awesome! I have a cordless Dremel, and while it can grind the nails down more quickly, it's so much louder than this grinder that my dogs are bothered by the noise and do not tolerate it so well.
customer_reviews.author: Tianyu Zhou

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought
customer_reviews.text: I was under the impression this would grind my dog's nails down to size with ease, but after opening the package and reading the material I noticed it suggests you clip with clippers first. My dog does not sit still long enough and does not trust clippers, which is why I wanted to try this option. He likes having his nails done with this grinder, but it is not a clipper! Why is clipper in the name if it does not work as such and does not come with clippers as well? I feel I paid to much for this and do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa

customer_reviews.title: No pain for pet or mom.
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Have used on one of my dogs. It takes a longer time to use the grinder than to just clip the nails. That being said I do believe it us safer. I have cut the the dog's quik before which is painful for not only the dog but also the mom. If you have the time, I feel it is safer for the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works better than normal dog nail clipper
customer_reviews.text: I like this electric paw trimmer clipper a lot as it does not scare my dog away as the normal dog nail clipper does. It is quiet and efficient. Get the job done easily! Will definitely recommend this product to my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi dog

customer_reviews.title: great nail grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4 month old kitten that I do nail trimming for. This thing is perfect . It’s not loud at all. It doesn’t take a long time to do it so he doesn’t mind it. The battery for us works forever but we charged it completely when we got it before using it. I also wash the tip after using it and it still works the same as the first time. Absolutely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie liang

customer_reviews.title: Not happy can’t use missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I received product and never received the grinding wheel it comes with or the two bonus wheels it said I would get
customer_reviews.author: Colleen K Grant

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't recommend this tool at all. Spent literally 5 minutes on one nail which didn't get filed down at all by the end of it. All it did successfully was aggravate my patient dog. I could have sanded his nails down with an emery board faster. Definitely not suitable for larger breeds either- the additional attachment is bigger as recommended but it still couldn't grind down the nail.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet and efficient! My dog who HATES getting her nails trimmed with scissors freaked out for a minute until she realized that this wasnt anywhere near as bad and then was so easy to work on. I managed to do all her nails in like 10 mins max. It usually takes 45 mins-1hr because of holding her down and squirming and inevitably chasing her around the house a couple times. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: a.Heinz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool!
customer_reviews.text: This works very very well. My dog hates having her nails trimmed. She has very short quicks. This grinds down her nails so that they are no longer pointie and sharp. I started by filing each nail for only 2-3 seconds. Then she got a treat. After a week she now lets me take as long as I want. She still get a great!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This product does an ok job, but it takes a long time. Not designed to do a full nail job - only to buff the cut edges after clipping. I kept them, will just do the nails more often.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Only got a single use of of this.
customer_reviews.text: I received this toward the end of March. I used it one time and when I tried to use it yesterday, the device will not come on. I tried to charge it but nadda. Either the charging mechanism is caput or the device itself is caput. And the deadline to return it recently passed. I would NOT buy again. I could have gone to Petsmart for a single nail grinding service for the cost of this and someone else would have done the work. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Great Clippers!
customer_reviews.text: Great clippers for my dog. It was easy to use and cuts evenly at different lengths with low noise. Very easy to control and the battery life was long. My little Yorkie was not frightened at all and is now enjoying his new summer style. Would definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Purrrfect outta the box...
customer_reviews.text: Directly out of the box. My male cat is very skitzee. But, after getting him settled in my lap he was quiet and comfortable as it ground his nails. He actually was purring by the time I finished with his first paw. Minimal amount of noise. Let's see how long it lasts. Baby girl is next.
customer_reviews.author: just my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: After one time of cutting my dogs nail too short, I am nervous cutting his nails which makes him nervous too. I bought this to use on my black lab Rufus. It couldn't be any easier to use! This makes trimming his nails so easy, he didn't mind at all. It is so quiet so it didn't bother him, and it is easy to buff his nails down to the appropriate length quickly and easily. This has made it so much easier to trim his nails, I won't need to pay someone to cut them anymore! THANK YOU for a great product! I couldn't recommend this more. And I love having the option to recharge it using the USB port.
customer_reviews.author: JR Kus

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: The nails got melted like butter. I used another brand before (Hertzco) (it broke) but I think this one is sharper.
customer_reviews.author: Alena Mayer

customer_reviews.title: NOT for use on medium-large dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Got this on recommendation of friend, who uses it on her puppy. Unfortunately, it has neither the grinding capability or strength to descrease length of my Vizsla or Large Mutt’s nails. Barely “polished” the smallest—gave up. Likely great for a cat or very young puppy but certainly nothing larger or with stronger nails. Back to my (noisy but effective) Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: SB Horse Mom

customer_reviews.title: useful nail grander for my husky
customer_reviews.text: The grander is very easy to use and clean. My dog doesn't like the traditional nail cutter, cuz that makes him scared maybe. They are ok to let me trim their nail by the electric grinder. It is easy to handle, so it won't hurt my dog's toes. Very nice tool for trimming. Worth to get one.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie_and_Bone

customer_reviews.title: Helpful, convenient, soft
customer_reviews.text: This one makes your work more convenient and makes your cat feel more comfortable. Unlike the normal nail cutter, this one can make your cat’s nail become softer and smoother. In addition, this can help prevent your cat from being hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Didn’t work that well for us.
customer_reviews.text: it’s either not powerful enough or the sander piece isn’t rough enough. It almost made my pets nails more rough because it just takes too long so I couldn’t get it done thoroughly. I have a 6lb pug puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe my dog let me use this!
customer_reviews.text: Such a pleasant surprise this actually works for my dog. My 2 yr old pug puppy is rather wild and uncontrollable about things he doesn't want to do, but after some minor evasion he mostly just lets me calmly grind his nails. Will save so much money from the groomer! Its very quiet, very light weight and easy to use. Recharges in a snap, no batteries. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: PoolWalker

customer_reviews.title: Green Light "Go".  Red Light "Return"
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted this to work. We spend so much money on getting our two cats' claws trimmed, that this would have been a real help in cutting (pun intended) costs. Alas, first charge went smoothly...red light charging indicator turned to green and we were "off to the races"! Cats seemed to tolerate it (sort of) but I had hopes. Spent quite a while with this trimmer and the cats to get them used to it being near (or touching) their feet. Went to recharge...one hour on charger...red...two hours...red....four hours....red...overnight...STILL red!!! Yeesh! On front porch today waiting for UPS to pick it up to return to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jallen

customer_reviews.title: So thankful I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a lifesaver! My dog was literally traumatized by having her nails clipped - clipping even one would cause her to yelp, snap, and sometimes pee herself (even though I never cut the quick). She doesn't love the feeling of this grinder, but she will tolerate it with only a little squirming, and that's a huge improvement. It's quiet, and powerful enough to actually take off length without having to press too hard. It does take a little while, but it's a much calmer experience than clipping. Most importantly, I know it's going to improve my relationship with my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey M. Reich

customer_reviews.title: Safe & Effective
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates nail clippers and will scream when I try to trim his nails using a regular clipper. It's been a nightmare thinking about trimming his nails. He's not so reluctant to this grinder and will let me grind him nails slowly. This grinder is really safe, so I don't need to worry about hurting him when he moves around or my hands are unstable. I really like that it's portable so that I can take them anywhere. The battery last long too. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Hong

customer_reviews.title: Works well on dewclaws, not very much on other nails
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our terrier because she doesn't like our dremel. Even though it was significantly quieter, she didn't like this tool as well. We used it on the dewclaws for out Border Collie and Australian Shepherd and it was really well. It didn't work near as well on their regular names since they're larger and thicker. Overall, $20ish for an easier way to trim the two big dogs dewclaws was worth it. It's nice that it's battery powered so a cord doesn't get in the way when you're trying to trim the dogs nails.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Cooper

customer_reviews.title: This INVENHO Pet Nail Grinder is the super awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This INVENHO Pet Nail Grinder is the super awesome! I've tried several brands of these dog nail grinders since my little Chorkie and my little Cheagle are terrified of the clippers to the point that I just can't do it to them. They were both uncomfortable at first with this but soon realized the was no clipping sound and they relaxed. No more paying a groomer to torture them, yay! This one is strong, quiet, super quick and effective. Thank you INVENHO for making such a helpful product!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: The dog and I both love this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I really recommend this nail trimmer for its ease of use, quiet operation, and long run time between charges. I just completed the fifth trim since the last recharge, and it was not showing any signs of losing power even yet. My little dog just lays back on my lap and closes his eyes because this trimmer doesn’t scare him. I can hold it several ways, depending on the angle I wish to use, and it’s so lightweight that it never feels awkward. Best money I’ve ever spent on any dog grooming device.
customer_reviews.author: SilverCat

customer_reviews.title: So not cool
customer_reviews.text: My 5 cats are traumatised when I turn this thing on. They hate hate hate it. They try to claw their way out of having this touch them. We have switched to clippers and these crazy little nail caps that really do work. They sit through having 10 little caps put on calmly and only slightly annoyed, but certainly not freaked out like they are by this machine. I guess I will have to use it for wood working since I can't return.
customer_reviews.author: DLSUDS

customer_reviews.title: Heaven sent mail grinder.
customer_reviews.text: Thank You so much. This nail trimmer is heaven sent. My Dane was not having it when it came to trimming his nails. We tried everything even another type of drommel tool but it was too loud. This grinder is really quiet. So much so that I was able to slowly introduce him to it. It Only took two times for him to sit and basically give me his paws to trim with this nail grinder. Again I can’t thank you enough.
customer_reviews.author: 2Ts

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I was wanting a grinder that was quiet enough not to scare the pups but strong enough to get the job done for some big dogs with big nails. It has a cap for storage and then a safety cap but for me I find it easier to remove it to be able to get all around the nail. It comes with a charger and an extra grinding wheel. My dogs do not like their nails clipped as the pressure hurts when squeezing down on the nail. But they do not mind this grinder one bit. It comes pre-charged which is a plus for impatient people like me. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Naxi

customer_reviews.title: Cut the claw first!
customer_reviews.text: Quiet enough for a cat (although mine isn’t afraid of much). Works great and rounding out the edge of the claw. Must trim nail first if there is any considerable length on the claw! If you don’t trim first, it will take ages and your pet will become more stressed out. Easy to hold. Love that is is USB chargeable rather than inserted battery operated.
customer_reviews.author: Mike11058

customer_reviews.title: Wish this worked better, Waste of my time
customer_reviews.text: And money. Pets hated trims Noise scared them. Still have to pay $10 each for a nail trim. Ugh!!
customer_reviews.author: WyogalTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Good use over a year - better not drop it
customer_reviews.text: This item worked well for me for the year that I used it. It took a decent fall off my grooming shelf (about 5 feet) and won't even turn on now. I have the same complaint with a pair of clippers that I ordered from another company. Equipment should be able to stand up to some durability. Granted this was a higher fall than just off my groom table so I'm not too upset about it. I just wish one fall wouldn't completely ruin the thing. It's an item that, overall, I'm glad I bought and it worked well over the course of the year I had it.
customer_reviews.author: EmalieAnn Allen

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item April 4th and it was working great and now it no longer works. It is charged and when you turn it on it does nothing. I wouldn’t recommend this product if it’s only going to last 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Couture

customer_reviews.title: Good for small pups
customer_reviews.text: This is the third nail grinder I buy from Amazon. This is also the best of the three. I have very small pups and it’s always a challenge to trim their nails. This works well and I like that it has 2 speeds. I use the highest speed on my dog with thicker nails. They don’t like it but honestly they wouldn’t like any nail grinder. I find it to also be safe. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria K

customer_reviews.title: super quiet and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Dremel for years to trim my dogs nails. The noise from it, makes my dogs nervous about nail trims. I saw this trimmer and read the reviews, and ordered it. I love this thing, and it is so quiet I can hardly hear it run and the diamond grinding wheel does a smooth wonderful job. It works equally well on my German Shepherd and my Pomeranian. Just exactly what I was looking for AAA +++ HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Judy Taunt

customer_reviews.title: Kujo turned lamb
customer_reviews.text: I've had my dog for 5 years. Before I got her, the shelter cut her nails too short. She wouldn't let me touch her paws. She would even draw blood. Before covid we would walk 5 to 13 miles a day on pavement. Since covid, I'm lucky to hit 3000 steps. With those numbers I never had to trim her nails until this year. Took her to the groomers and she turned into kujo. A vet recommended this grinder. Now I'm able to trim her nails. 12 pound chihuahua mix, age 7-9, not used to getting nails trimmed.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: An actual product that works!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs hate getting their nails trimmed. I have NEVER been able to do that. Petco started dremmeling her nails instead of clipping, which gets closer to the quick without cutting into it. So I bought this, being a true skeptic, she doesn't mind the little noise (hates thunder), she acts like I'm just looking at her paws, fantastic, and this unit and seller had the best price and reviews and the grinder is quiet, but can't judge, but I do own a real dremmel, it's way quieter than that. My dog is a lab, I would recommend this. A nail a day is all it takes.
customer_reviews.author: BozX

customer_reviews.title: Excelent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Highly recommended. I'm updating my comment. The product is excellent and the seller (dogjog) is the best, the customer service is unbeatable. I bought two products and one of them after almost three months stopped working. Contact the seller (who was very kind) and in a very short time he answered me and sent me a new one. The new product is working perfectly. Many thanks to DogJog for their excellent service. Again, I recommend the seller and the product 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A Arredondo 7

customer_reviews.title: Good for cats
customer_reviews.text: This takes the sharp tip off cat claws. I let him look at it, listen to it, pretended to use it on my nails, and then did a couple of claws at a time. He's blase about the whole thing now. Just don't get too determined to do them all at first. An easy early introduction is key. My cat used to throw a drama fit about the clipper, but he's fine with this. I like the results much better - the claws don't split and they are rounded at the end.
customer_reviews.author: Henrietta

customer_reviews.title: This product is good
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dog who’s about 20 pounds. His nails grow soooo fast it’s just not worth going to the groomer all the time. I love this because I feel better that I’m not going to hurt him he is scared of it despite all of my efforts to condition him to it. However, he is scared of mostly everything, so this isn’t a surprise. He does allow me to do his nails pretty easily, just does not like the sound. It gets through the nail easily and fast, so it doesn’t take long at all. Overall, a must for any dog owner who doesn’t want to spend a ton of money at the groomer monthly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucky chen

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and just as described. Very easy to use. One thing I will say to first time users...use it on the low speed! And start out just grazing the tips. At first it kinda tickles them but they get used to it. Plus there is nothing to stop you from over grinding. So you need to put your readers on and really look at what your doing. If you have a cat...you might need two people because my cat kept retracting her claws.
customer_reviews.author: Kcathy2011

customer_reviews.title: My dog is terrified of this!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is TERRIFIED of this. The noise and vibration it puts in his nails. And when I held him long enough to get it on his nails it didn’t seem like it was doing anything to the nail. Now my dog won’t even come near me if I have it in my hand now. he runs away and cowers. I chose to return the product but instead they sent me a replacement and didn’t refund my money back so I don’t know what to do with the one I have now and I’m not getting my money back. I’m extremely disappointed in this product and return service.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: all the pet owner must buy !!!
customer_reviews.text: i used to use my own nail grinder to my dog and cats , it was an nightmare to do that. they like jump on to my knee , my knee has a lot of of scratch because of that. but since i bought this item, my i’m afraid of them to scratch my leg anymore. very convenience to use and very time saving. and it is rechargeable and the battery last. plus the noise are not as loud as other nail grinder. my pets won’t be afraid of it. i am so regret that i should have bought this couple years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a tough time deciding on a model, but made the right choice. I slowly introduced it to my dog and he warmed up to it. Very quiet and has two speeds. Gets the job done. It did take a few attempts before he realized it wasn't clippers. Common sense, but if you stay on 1 nail too long the metal grinder portion will heat up by natural friction and surely make your pet uncomfortable. I tested the threshold on myself, and it didnt heat up but my nails aren't like dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Bleujai

customer_reviews.title: Love the design and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really like the design of this trimmer. It is light weighted and cordless! Just trimmed my dog's nail this morning with it. My dog doesn't seem to notice any difference between this new one and the old grinder trimmer. I was able to do it away from the power outlet. Our old one has to be connected to power while using. The grinder bit is similar to our old sandpaper bit and there is an extra bit comes with the package. Wonder how long the battery would last.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Meeker

customer_reviews.title: Thank god for electric files
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to file the pups nails because 1)I’m too scared to cut them myself (they’re black and I can’t see the kwik (little blood vessel in the nail that can be hurt if snipped) and 2) going to the vet it petsmart was too pricey for what I got. I was filing her nails by hand with a nail file (the heavy duty ones) but it became tedious . I’m glad I got this- she was a little scared but she’s gotten used to it and she’s pretty compliant now!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold, quiet, low vibration, and it dies the job!
customer_reviews.text: My dog would not let me, or her vet, clip her nails. When they said she would need to be sedated to do it, I knew there must be a better way. I considered the Dremel, but having read the reviews for the Invenho, decided to give it a try. My dog has big, thick nails, but Dixie will let me trim one or two in a sitting, as long as she has a peanut butter laced dog bone to chew on. Thank goodness for this device! It will get the job done and my dog doesn’t freak out! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Notastatist

customer_reviews.title: Didn't do what I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I thought, oh boy, finally something that might work on my rescue Mastiffs nails. He HATES the clippers. He has to get sedated at the vets for a nail trim at 200.00 a pop. Yikes. So I figured, this was worth a try. I couldn't have been more wrong. The noise is similar to a Dremel but the power torque is weak. I was hoping to get the sharp tips smoothed but he HATES this as much as the clippers. I know he's a big dog, 145lbs. but it would take all day to do one nail and he was biting it after 5 seconds. I was a big disappointment for me 😭
customer_reviews.author: Mastiffmom

customer_reviews.title: Harley is happy
customer_reviews.text: Harley, a Dachshund/Shih tzu mix, is much happier with me grinding vs clipping. His nails grow like crazy and whenever I clip I nearly always hit the vein. He hates that! Clipping one time and and grinding the rest of the way has proved to be safer and much more tolerable to the dog. It also helps me to be more timely when it is necessary to clip his nails rather than procrastinating and pushing it off.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all the pets!!!
customer_reviews.text: We had the first one that came out and the dogs hated it due to the noise. This is so smooth, small, and quiet. I can use on all three dogs and on my Parrot’s beak. I used to take my Parrot in every 3 months to trim his beak and now I get to save that expense! Battery lasts through all 4 pets on one charge. Great gift for pet owners. Top is removable when you need more access to the grinder or get in hard to reach places. Would work great for all pets that need nails or beaks trimmed.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Worth the effort and price for not cutting to close to the vein.
customer_reviews.text: First time user of a nail grinder. These are wonderful and wish I purchased sooner. Took my little guy time to get used to having his nails done this way because mine is a squirmer. Took me awhile to get his nail in at the right angle through the hole. This one even has a polisher. It comes with a USB charging cable connection and aa second grinder. It's small so not weighted in my hand which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great dremel
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, but does need to be charged more often then I would have expected. I have to charge it between my two dogs or use it while plugged into the wall. Otherwise, my dogs don’t mind it at all. They much rather use this then trimming alone. Makes it much easier to not have to clip so much off the nail, making the trim quicker for them, because I can get it close enough with the dremel to get them as short as I like.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Grinders are just for small dogs...
customer_reviews.text: They really shouldn't advertise using grinders on anything bigger than a pug. If there's any more meat to a nail than that - grinders are essentially worthless. The grit-level is simply too low to actually take anything off and it's more likely to just heat up your poor dog's nail than substantially reduce it or clean it up. For the record, this is quiet and easy to use which is why it's getting three stars and not one - just thought they should get the feedback and clean up their sales pitch.
customer_reviews.author: WhatsThatNoise

customer_reviews.title: Safe and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have two kittens. As we all know, the growth rate of cat nails is amazing. One day, I browsed on Amazon and found this. I bought it and used it. It turned out, oh my god! It's so easy to use, my cat won't resist it, it's simple and safe to use, it greatly improves my efficiency, and the nails after trimming will be smooth. Really good! I would recommend it to people who have pets around.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works but not extremely heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Works to file nails down but if nails are long, it is best to trim them first. Not as heavy duty as professional brands, but for this price point, it works. I use it on my 70 pound dog and prefer to take the guard off. I however, would not recommend taking the guard off unless you are comfortable grinding nails. I tried using this on my cats and they do not like the noise nor the grinding sensation on their nails.
customer_reviews.author: Megan ChicosTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It "works"
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this works just fine for smaller pets but for medium+size animals it takes waaaaaaaay too long. I have 2 medium dogs (~50lbs) and even after initially clipping the nails short to just do some cleanup with the grider takes like 3-5 minutes PER NAIL (~15mins Per paw?!)! That's insanity... The grinder is really quiet; a soft hum so it'll probably be good for most pets afraid of noises. One of my dogs still did not like the noise though so she ran away as soon as it was turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Hand Clippers Also!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I missed reading about this product that you had to hand clip your pet's nails and use the electric one just to touch up rough edges, but I doubt it. This was not the nail filer I thought I had ordered. Thank you anyway for your great return policy!!!! PSM
customer_reviews.author: Paul Maassen

customer_reviews.title: Best Nail Grinder
customer_reviews.text: So so so glad I finally bought this nail grinder. My dog never got his dew claws taken off as a puppy so I have to monitor their length fairly often. It's not a fun experience for him to get his nails chopped at the vet and they don't file his nails so not great for either of us. Just got this in the mail and tested it out right away. Love that it arrived already charged, it is cordless, and comes with an additional grinder. So ridiculously easy to use and very affordable. Dog and I are both very glad we have this now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good product! I have a little Pom who is anxious about grooming so I do all the grooming myself. This has made it so easy to file down his nails and it doesn’t leave jagged sharp edges. He seems relaxed around it and it lasts such a long time. It takes about 5 mins for me to trim his nails and I have only had to charge it once since I bought this a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job on our small skittish dog.
customer_reviews.text: We have a Havanese who is very skittish. She was traumatized the first time we tried this, but after watching the video, we decided to have another go at it. The second time she laid still, shaking, but not fighting it. And we've been totally forgiven. I think that she'll get totally used to the process. as she realizes it isn't hurting, and this is much easier and less painful than trying to use the clippers. That tramatize both dog and owner.
customer_reviews.author: Lazell

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: My pup doesn’t like getting her nails trimmed at all, I have to have someone hold her down while I do it usually. This tool is extremely quiet and powerful! I am so glad I ended up purchasing it.. worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa Reeker

customer_reviews.title: Easy and works great.
customer_reviews.text: I’m to scared to try to cut my dogs huge thick claws. So I use this instead. It does take some patience but it’s still quick and easy. It’s not instant. Probably takes about 2 min each nail. But that depends on how long you let them get. I always wait too long and it takes longer than it should. If I didn’t wait so long it would take a lot less time for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. No more fear!
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today and I immediately tried it. It is almost silent, has a very light vibration and Best Of All! gently and easily trimmed my 85# dog's nails - without trauma! Literally life transforming for both of us! Very attractive design too - light weight, but diamond wheel so works very efficiently. Love that it is rechargeable. 5 Plus Stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works quietly.
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is small and very quiet. It gets a little louder as it actually presses on the claw, but not bad. I've been getting my dog used to it very slowly because she has always been freaked out by anyone trying to trim her nails. I'm hopeful that I'll be able to do it. I had thought that I'd just have the vet cut them, but that didn't go great. I think using this trimmer at home will be less traumatic for her.
customer_reviews.author: Lise in Ocean Shores

customer_reviews.title: Every Pet Owner Needs This Nail Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing!!! I have a Carin Terrier- Poodle Mix Dog named Brodie. He is a rescue and is hates getting his nails trimmed. He Yelps at even the tiniest cut. With this nail grinder I was able to grind down all of his nails with minimal hesitation and no signs of stress from him. This is a life saver!! I will recommend this to anyone that has a dog or animal! No noise, light weight, fast charging, excellent grinder quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats! Effective, quiet, and gentle.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great for cats. I have two, including one who is very anxious and grumpily tolerates having her nails clipped. I wanted to start grinding my cats' nails smooth after clipping and did a fair bit of research on different tools. This one is definitely worth it. The grinding bit gets the job done and is not painful or startling (you can put your finger against it while it is on). Also, the noise is a very low hum. Even my anxious cat lets me grind her nails with no extra fuss than she would make from clipping.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Prather

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: First set I have tried and used. So I have nothing to compare it to. But this allowed me to finally trim a nail that curled under and was touching his pad. (small weaner dog)I could not get the clippers in the gab to cut. So I bought these to try to resolve it. They worked like a charm. Little grind here and there and it was back to looking like a normal claw again. My dog didn't mind it too much. He hates his paws being touched but once I started he sat back and let me finish.Low noise. Overall - impressed with price to quality to far
customer_reviews.author: LISA

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Our rescue pit bull mix was a challenge to get her nails trimmed, she tried to bite everyone around and even trying to put a muzzle on her was a fight on an otherwise sweet dog, she just didn't like it. Then we got the Invenho nail grinder and it's the best thing ever. No more fights, my daughter does it when our dog is laying on a bench or the couch and with little noise Kota barely moves and in a matter of minutes her nails are trimmed! Best part is that we can do it more often and with a pit bull it has to be done. We highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and not too loud
customer_reviews.text: It works really well and it's not too loud so my puppy didnt get scared. The only thing is that there isnt a cover so all the grinded nails just fly everywhere. Other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: M.P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought other brands of nail grinder before, but my dog ​​will never let me use them. Therefore, I never knew how to cut my dog's nails. This time I saw the price of this brand is quite good, so I decided to place an order and try again. To my surprise, my dog ​​actually made me sharpen her nails. I think the biggest reason should be because there is almost no noise from this nail grinder. The price is really cheap, so I think it is a high value product. Recommend that everyone can buy it and give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Yun

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC NAIL TRIMMER FOR YOUR DOG
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs: pit bull and a shepherd/husky/mutt. Both dogs have incredibly thick fast growing nails and this trimmer is quite, lightweight and very easy to use. My shepherd has serious anxiety as he was a rescue and is still not thrilled about the trimmer but we are getting there. Let your dog sniff the trimmer and let them feel the very minimal vibration of the trimmer, use as directed and you are good to go. The only thing that would make this trimmer better is if it came with the wall outlet attachment for easy charging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: This is easy enough to use although it doesn't have much power. For smaller dogs this may be alright. However, I have a 90 lb Doberman that this takes forever for. I clipped his nails first and was using this to smooth them down. He loves using his paws but HATES having them trimmed. This took almost half an hour after trimming them. He didn't seem to mind the feeling or sound, but he was bored and didn't want to sit still for it after about ten minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far
customer_reviews.text: These are working great so far. Super quiet, at least until you start grinding the nail. They cut fast enough that I didn't need to use clippers before hand. I just ground down the nail with these. I have used the "as seen on TV" pedi paws before and these are better in every way. I almost didn't buy these because of the pedipaws. They would stall out on first contact with the nail. But with these, you really have to try to stall them out.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My fear was it wouldn't do a good job. BUT it is GREAT! I have really bad hands and small wiggly dogs that don't like noises. These are easy to hold and the noise is small. The best part, it did a great job. I've used them for abs 4 months now. It also came with an extra head, so I won't need to replace it for a long time!v LOVE this product!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R.

customer_reviews.title: Returned -Dog Hated
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it works great, it looked great, but ultimately after a week of scaring my dog, it was returned. I was really hopeful since it talks about how quiet it is, but my dog refused! It was a bit louder than I expected but still quieter than a previous brand I tried. That being said, I knew to introduce it, give a treat, turn it on, give a treat, etc. I tried to use it every day for a whole week, and my dog just would not stay calm enough to actually grind the nail. So I returned it and will continue clipping my dogs nails.
customer_reviews.author: ses1010

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This product worked perfect for me I have had other nail grinders and never quite powerful enough my dogs HATE getting there nails cut this made it super easy my dogs nails were so overgrown they started curling into his paw I got the job done in about 30 minutes he only whined about having his paw held. I would recommend for anyone with picky dogs who hate nail clippers. I bought an extra attachment for later use but one did the job for 2 dogs and still has plenty of life left. 10/10 would reccomend. Only product that has worked for me in over 7 years
customer_reviews.author: nilka

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to trim our dog’s nails. When he goes to the groomer, she uses a grinder on his nails and she has found he tolerates these well. Husband used them last week for the first time and liked them. Our Boxer didn’t seem to mind the noise level, my husband found them easy to use. I would recommend these .
customer_reviews.author: sheryl brockett

customer_reviews.title: Wow, should’ve ordered long ago
customer_reviews.text: This is the best I’ve had. It’s a replacement for a different one that I had for years that broke. I was very hesitant but when I ordered the same one I had for years, it was not the same. I think they must have licensed it.it was made so cheaply I sent it back the same day. This one is so quite, and does a great job. I have 3 maltese. Hopefully it will last for years
customer_reviews.author: Denise’s Banman

customer_reviews.title: Still scary for dogs
customer_reviews.text: I had to try this grinder because my dogs won't let me cut their nails and it's too expensive to take them to the vet or groomer every 2 weeks to get them cut. It's pretty loud and can sometimes vibrate their nails too much if they're not positioned correctly, but it gets the job done. My dogs still hate to get their nails trimmed, but it's not as hard as with the clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen W.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t correct a dog who hates it’s nails done
customer_reviews.text: It’s very quiet until it’s against a nail obviously. That’s the be expected... It was very easy to hold and has 2 different speeds.. also you can bid it at different angels if needed which makes it easier to get nails if you have to tackle your dog! Jk... I was hoping my pit bull would allow me to do his nails with this but he just won’t sit still and gets angry just like he does with cutters 🤷‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Famez

customer_reviews.title: Life saver product
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this nail grinder. I was so worried that this product won't suit my dog, that I won't be able to use it on him at all, although I love the idea that I don't have to use a nail clipper. My dog is very suspicious of any strange sound and any foreign object in my hand when I pat him, but with this item, all goes so smoothly. He did not care about the sound, nor the fact that I was grinding his nails. He was calm, almost nonchalant about what I was doing. Life is much easier now. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gaudreau

customer_reviews.title: Even my fussy terrier doesn’t mind this!
customer_reviews.text: My rat terrier has had overgrown nails since I got him at 9 mos—I don’t think anyone ever trimmed his nails before that. The quicks are really long, so a groomer can only take off a tiny bit at a time. Doing it at home would be a way to trim them frequently to encourage the quicks tk recede, but he is really fussy about having his feet touched at all, and will scream with the clipper. This tool has been a game changer. While he doesn’t LIKE it per se, he will calmly tolerate me holding him and working on his nails. They’re looking better already—looking forward to him finally have nice short nails!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Maier

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and work well
customer_reviews.text: The product is super easy to use and it’s very quiet. Strong and long lasting power. It’s exactly what I’m looking for! I used to spend at least an hour to clip my golden’s nail but now I only need 5 mins. I highly recommend this product if your pet doesn’t like to get his nail clipped.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this. It was easy and fast to charge. It was really easy to maneuver around both of my dogs paws and was also quick. Neither dog enjoyed the experience, but it was bliss compared to me clipping their nails the old way... The only minus is that nail dust gets everywhere. I've never found a nail grinder that is good at capturing the dust without losing a lot in being able to move the nail on the grind stone, so I'm not going to deduct a star for that. Overall I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M Curran

customer_reviews.title: A dream
customer_reviews.text: My little shih poo hates to have his nails cut. It is a constant fight when it comes to cutting his nails. But with this that problem is gone. He will lay on his back in my lap and just let me grind those nails down. No more tugging or scared I'm going to cut him. Absolutely a dream come true. Easy to use. Keeps a long charge and feels natural in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Munchkin

customer_reviews.title: LCD Display makes it different
customer_reviews.text: I had another clipper before. As I use occasionally, sometimes, when I squeeze a time to cut hair, the clipper stop working in half way as run out of battery. Now, this one is a real smart device. Its LCD display tells me how much remaining power is in the battery. If it is low, I would charge it first.
customer_reviews.author: Sissi

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for doing what can be a difficult job
customer_reviews.text: Trimming our pups nails was always a challenge, she hated it! But we followed the instructions, got her familiar with it before ever trying to use it, and now she actually thinks it's something enjoyable and no longer a struggle. Naturally it takes a lot longer to get the same amount of trimming done, but well worth it for not having to have the stress and potential concern around cutting that we had previously. I would just suggest to follow the instructions and definitely let the dog get acclimated to it for some time before actually trying to use it. Once they're comfortable with it they don't see it as something bad.
customer_reviews.author: RJD

customer_reviews.title: Only good for finish sanding of large nails
customer_reviews.text: It’s only good for finish sanding of my large dog’s nails (black lab, pit). I thought I’d be able to grind them down like a Dremel tool but it’s not even close. The battery gets weak after a few long nails. I will need to clip like normal then use this tool to finish sand the nails. It only helps a little in my situation.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: As a professional groomer I've tried them all. This is a nice grinder, especially for nervous digs and novice users. I gave 2 dtsrs because it broke after just 4 times using it. And no, it wasn't dropped! It just quit working. Frustrating and embarrassing in front of a customer. This may have been just a defect with the unit but I'm not a happy customer. Didn't try to get it replaced as I waited too long. My mistake. Won't buy again!
customer_reviews.author: katesulak

customer_reviews.title: Dog actually bears with it
customer_reviews.text: My shiba hates having her nails trimmed, but this helps make it much easier to consistently groom her and make sure her nails don't get too long. After getting her accustomed to the sound, she sits fairly still while I'm going at her nails, and I feel like I have much more control with this grinder than with clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: For smaller dogs. Great product though
customer_reviews.text: It is quiet. It is very easy to use It is also for smaller dogs. My 70LB German Shepherd’s nails are too big to use this product as it’s suppose to be used. Everything else was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Elwood

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and gentle alternative to clippers!
customer_reviews.text: I've used other nail grinders in the past, and they were always too loud. This one is whisper-quiet, so it doesn't stress out the puppy when he hears it. The head has a nice guard on it for tiny nails, and a replacement head is included in the package (nice touch!). This is truly one of the nicest grinders I've used. Time will tell how well it holds up!
customer_reviews.author: Camille Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it so far
customer_reviews.text: So far, it works well. The noise level is great - pry just as quiet or quieter than my electronic toothbrush. Puppy food not mind the grind at all. It's def a tool that you use for quick seconds at a time vs just holding the grindstone to the nail. Used it on a 5 month old Shih Tzu.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the pet nail grinder
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered this in the winter but due to weather it never arrived so I got a refund and decided to try this again. Received it almost the following day after I ordered it. Put it to the test with my 80 lb black lab and he laid there like a baby and didn't even flinch like he use to with the manual nail clippers. I love it! It charges quick too!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brower

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My Boston Terrier can’t go to petsmart anymore he is too aggressive with staff and they can’t muzzle him due to short snout. He will finally let me near his paws with this gadget. It’s so quiet. I tried a regular grinding tool and it didn’t work because it was so loud he ran and hid from it. This thing saved me!
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Its alot quieter then the nail filers from petco/Walmart. My lil fella used hate the noise of his old nail filer. With this one, he flinches but he's alot less irritated. It's a quiet humming noise. 1 full charge has lasted us 8times every 2 weeks. It has power and files down really quick and easy to manuver. I love it. From 2hrs down to 30mins including trimming, filing and smoothing out the nails, I'm happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: Clumsyjelly

customer_reviews.title: Great pet nail grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have never done trimming my dog's nails before because he is terrified at all grinder and doesn't let me to trim or grind his nails. Every once in a while I have to take him to the grooming store to do his nails. My friend recommended this grinder to me and I bought it and tried it on my dog. It worked. It is very quite and have two speed, it can be used wirelessly and comes with usb charger. I can do my dog's nail at home now and I am very happy with this great product. I will share it with my other friends and families.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

product_meta.title: INVENHO Pet Nail Grinder Electric Paw Trimmer Clipper Small Medium Large Dogs Cats Small Animals Portable & Rechargeable Gentle Painless Paws Grooming Trimming Shaping Smoothing
feature_bullets: The dog nail Grinder is improved with diamond bit Grinder, which is safer and more effective, no replacements needed. Reducing the risk of clipping the claws too short or hurt your pet.

Equipped with three ports and 2 speed switch, the trimmer is widely applied to small, Medium, Large pets with different size nails.You can choose an appropriate port and speed depending on your pet's size and nail hardness for nails Grinding.
Pet clippers for dogs with precision motor, low vibration design, free It from work noise of low than 40DB, to help the pet feel ease, making your pet no fear to trim their nails.
Our nail Grinder is rechargeable; and includes a USB wire for your convenience, The piece over the stone can be removed for easy cleaning.
This product was sold by dogjog. Any questions, please leave your messages, we will reply within 24 hour. Thanks for coming to dogjog and enjoy your shopping.
